lead_paragraph: “Maus,” the Pulitzer Prize-winning graphic novel about a Jewish family during World War II, has been removed from many bookshelves in Moscow because it bears a swastika on its cover.

headline.print_headline: To Be Safe, Bookstores in Russia Pull Novel
headline.main: ‘Maus’ Book About Holocaust Is Removed in Russia

snippet: “Maus,” the Pulitzer Prize-winning graphic novel about a Jewish family during World War II, has been removed from many bookshelves in Moscow because it bears a swastika on its cover.
abstract: Effort by Russian authorities to rid Moscow of all Nazi symbols before Victory Day, celebration of Soviet Union's defeat of Germany in World War II, leads inadvertently to bookstores removing Art Spiegelman's Pulitzer-Prize winning anti-fascist graphic novel Maus from shelves.
